t: Isaiah 28
Judgment on Ephraim and Jerusalem
Ah,*pn the proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim, and*ld the fading flower of its glorious beauty, which*ld is on the head of the rich valley of those overcome with wine!
Behold,*ln the Lord has one who is mighty and strong; like*ld a storm of hail, a destroying tempest, like*ln a storm of mighty, overflowing waters, he*ld casts down to the earth with his hand.
The*ln proud crown of the drunkards of Ephraim will*ld be trodden underfoot;

and*ln the fading flower of its glorious beauty, which*ld is on the head of the rich valley, will*ln be like a first-ripe fig before the summer: when*ld someone sees it, he swallows it as*ld soon as it is in his hand.
In*pn that day the Lord*s of hosts will be a crown of glory, and*ld a diadem of beauty, to the remnant of his people,
and*ln a spirit of justice to him who sits in judgment, and*ld strength to those who turn back the battle at the gate.

These*pn also reel with wine and*ld stagger with strong drink; the*ln priest and the prophet reel with strong drink, they*ld are swallowed by wine, they*ld stagger with strong drink, they*ln reel in vision, they*ld stumble in giving judgment.
For*ln all tables are full of filthy vomit, with*ld no space left.
“To*pn whom will he teach knowledge, and*ld to whom will he explain the message? Those*ln who are weaned from the milk, those*ld taken from the breast?
For*ln it is precept upon precept, precept upon precept, line*ld upon line, line upon line, here*ld a little, there a little.”
For*pn by people of strange lips and*ld with a foreign tongue the*ln Lord*s will speak to this people,
to*ld whom he has said, “This*ln is rest; give*ld rest to the weary; and*ln this is repose”; yet*ld they would not hear.

And*ln the word of the Lord*s will be to them precept*ln upon precept, precept upon precept, line*ld upon line, line upon line, here*ld a little, there a little, that*ln they may go, and fall backward, and*ld be broken, and snared, and taken.
A Cornerstone in Zion
Therefore*pn hear the word of the Lord,*s you scoffers, who*ld rule this people in Jerusalem!

Because*ln you have said, “We have made a covenant with death, and*ld with Sheol we have an agreement, when*ln the overwhelming whip passes through it*ld will not come to us, for*ln we have made lies our refuge, and*ld in falsehood we have taken shelter”;

therefore*ln thus says the Lord God,*s “Behold,*ln I am the one who has laid as a foundation in Zion, a*ld stone, a tested stone, a*ln precious cornerstone, of a sure foundation: ‘Whoever*ld believes will not be in haste.’
And*ln I will make justice the line, and*ld righteousness the plumb line; and*ln hail will sweep away the refuge of lies, and*ld waters will overwhelm the shelter.”
Then*ln your covenant with death will be annulled, and*ld your agreement with Sheol will not stand; when*ln the overwhelming scourge passes through, you*ld will be beaten down by it.
As*ln often as it passes through it will take you; for*ld morning by morning it will pass through, by*ld day and by night; and*ln it will be sheer terror to understand the message.
For*ln the bed is too short to stretch oneself on, and*ld the covering too narrow to wrap oneself in.
For*ln the Lord*s will rise up as on Mount Perazim; as*ld in the Valley of Gibeon he will be roused; to*ln do his deed— strange is his deed! and*ld to work his work— alien is his work!
Now*ln therefore do not scoff, lest*ld your bonds be made strong; for*ln I have heard a decree of destruction from*ld the Lord God*s of hosts against the whole land.
Give*pn ear, and hear my voice; give*ld attention, and hear my speech.
Does*ln he who plows for sowing plow continually? Does*ld he continually open and harrow his ground?
When*ln he has leveled its surface, does*ld he not scatter dill, sow cumin, and*ln put in wheat in rows and*ld barley in its proper place, and*ld emmer as the border?
For*ln he is rightly instructed; his*ld God teaches him.
Dill*pn is not threshed with a threshing sledge, nor*ld is a cart wheel rolled over cumin, but*ln dill is beaten out with a stick, and*ld cumin with a rod.
Does*ln one crush grain for bread? No,*ld he does not thresh it forever; when*ln he drives his cart wheel over it with*ld his horses, he does not crush it.
This*ln also comes from the Lord*s of hosts; he*ld is wonderful in counsel and*ld excellent in wisdom.
